revised_title: Phytoplankton Photosynthesis and Extracellular Product Release
tldr: The authors discovered that phytoplankton release a significant amount of extracellular products during photosynthesis, which was found to be between 7-50% of the total carbon fixed in the photic zone of the water column. This finding suggests that the widely used method for determining phytoplankton productivity may underestimate the true rate of fixation. The implications of this discovery for understanding trophic relationships in aquatic habitats are considered to be considerable.
